intro: Erysimum argyrocarpum, commonly known as the silverleaf wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its silvery-white, velvety leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and flowers. The species is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
